Skr.: ett lOO-tal tetkn. art. rör. brandskydd.
translated: Arild Uno A:son was a civil engineer born on August 21, 1894 in Stockholm to merchant parents Ernst Gustaf A. and Ida Larsson. He married Kaj Andersson on January 24th and had a son named Folke, born in 1928. Arild attended Norrmalm High School in Stockholm and graduated in 1914, then went on to obtain his degree in civil engineering from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1919. He also undertook study trips throughout Europe with scholarships and for business purposes between 1921 and 1946. Arild worked as a junior engineer at AB Swedish Machinery Works in Södertälje from 1918-1919, and later worked in sales and management positions at various engineering companies including Luth & Rosén’s Electrics AB, AB Henriksson’s Fire Fighting Equipment, and AB Pumpindustrii’s Fire Department in Gothenburg. He taught firefighting courses for officers in 1933 and was a member of the Swedish Society of Technical Engineers since 1920. Arild wrote over 100 technical articles on fire safety.

structured.name: Arild Uno A:son
